    • Advanced plotting with schnapps

    Advanced plotting with schnapps

    karyoplot.Rmd
    library(schnapps)

    Background

    This vignette will illustrate some advanced plotting functionality available in schnapps that allows plotting single cell profiles with ideograms and gene annotations. This additional functionaility requires the following bioconductor packages (which are not installed automatically): regioneR, karyploteR, biomaRt and GenomeInfoDb.

    library(regioneR)
library(karyoploteR)
library(biomaRt)
library(GenomeInfoDb)

    Data processing

    We’ll now process the data as in the introductory vignette and call haplotype specific copy number.

    data("haplotypes")
data("CNbins")
haplotypes <- format_haplotypes_dlp(haplotypes, CNbins)
hscn <- callHaplotypeSpecificCN(CNbins, haplotypes, phasebyarm = FALSE)

    Plotting

    We’ll now run through a series of examples that makes use of this plotting functionality.

    Genome wide plot with ideogram

    plotideogram(hscn, cellid = "SA921-A90554A-R05-C07")


    #> expression(kp <- karyoploteR::plotKaryotype(plot.type = 4, plot.params = pp, 
#>     chromosomes = chr), karyoploteR::kpAxis(kp, r0 = 0.52, r1 = 1), 
#>     karyoploteR::kpPoints(kp, data = data, y = data$BAF, r0 = 0.52, 
#>         r1 = 1, col = data$col_ASstate), karyoploteR::kpAxis(kp, 
#>         tick.pos = seq(0, maxCN, 2), r0 = 0, r1 = 0.48, ymax = maxCN, 
#>         ymin = 0), karyoploteR::kpPoints(kp, data = data, y = data$copy, 
#>         r0 = 0, r1 = 0.48, ymin = 0, ymax = maxCN, col = data$col_state))

    Genome wide plot with ideogram and gene annotations

    plotideogram(hscn, cellid = "SA921-A90554A-R05-C07", gene.symbols = c("TP53", "MYC"))


    #> expression(kp <- karyoploteR::plotKaryotype(plot.type = 4, plot.params = pp, 
#>     chromosomes = chr), karyoploteR::kpAxis(kp, r0 = 0.4, r1 = 0.75), 
#>     karyoploteR::kpPoints(kp, data = data, y = data$BAF, r0 = 0.4, 
#>         r1 = 0.75, col = data$col_ASstate), karyoploteR::kpAxis(kp, 
#>         tick.pos = seq(0, maxCN, 2), r0 = 0, r1 = 0.35, ymax = maxCN, 
#>         ymin = 0), karyoploteR::kpPoints(kp, data = data, y = data$copy, 
#>         r0 = 0, r1 = 0.35, ymin = 0, ymax = maxCN, col = data$col_state), 
#>     karyoploteR::kpPlotMarkers(kp, data = genes, labels = genes$hgnc_symbol, 
#>         line.color = "#555555", marker.parts = c(0.95, 0.025, 
#>             0.025), r1 = 1.05))

    Chrosome level plots with ideogram and gene annotations

    plotideogram(hscn, cellid = "SA921-A90554A-R05-C07", chr = c("8"), gene.symbols = c("MYC"))


    #> expression(kp <- karyoploteR::plotKaryotype(plot.type = 4, plot.params = pp, 
#>     chromosomes = chr), karyoploteR::kpAxis(kp, r0 = 0.4, r1 = 0.75), 
#>     karyoploteR::kpPoints(kp, data = data, y = data$BAF, r0 = 0.4, 
#>         r1 = 0.75, col = data$col_ASstate), karyoploteR::kpAxis(kp, 
#>         tick.pos = seq(0, maxCN, 2), r0 = 0, r1 = 0.35, ymax = maxCN, 
#>         ymin = 0), karyoploteR::kpPoints(kp, data = data, y = data$copy, 
#>         r0 = 0, r1 = 0.35, ymin = 0, ymax = maxCN, col = data$col_state), 
#>     karyoploteR::kpPlotMarkers(kp, data = genes, labels = genes$hgnc_symbol, 
#>         line.color = "#555555", marker.parts = c(0.95, 0.025, 
#>             0.025), r1 = 1.05))
    plotideogram(hscn, cellid = "SA921-A90554A-R05-C07", chr = c("17"), gene.symbols = c("TP53"))


    #> expression(kp <- karyoploteR::plotKaryotype(plot.type = 4, plot.params = pp, 
#>     chromosomes = chr), karyoploteR::kpAxis(kp, r0 = 0.4, r1 = 0.75), 
#>     karyoploteR::kpPoints(kp, data = data, y = data$BAF, r0 = 0.4, 
#>         r1 = 0.75, col = data$col_ASstate), karyoploteR::kpAxis(kp, 
#>         tick.pos = seq(0, maxCN, 2), r0 = 0, r1 = 0.35, ymax = maxCN, 
#>         ymin = 0), karyoploteR::kpPoints(kp, data = data, y = data$copy, 
#>         r0 = 0, r1 = 0.35, ymin = 0, ymax = maxCN, col = data$col_state), 
#>     karyoploteR::kpPlotMarkers(kp, data = genes, labels = genes$hgnc_symbol, 
#>         line.color = "#555555", marker.parts = c(0.95, 0.025, 
#>             0.025), r1 = 1.05))
